articles.author: Jessica Sier
articles.title: NVDA technology to help the blind read screens set to launch in the US - The Australian Financial Review
articles.description: Brisbane-based blind inventors Michael Curran and James Teh have signed up 38,000 American students to use their free screen reading software NVDA.
articles.content:
Mr Curran and Mr Teh met at a blind music camp and started building the screen reading technology NVDA around ten years ago.
Once theyd developed the software, the pair made it open source meaning d… [+1201 chars]
